Please, enlight me on the problems you had with MJ.

For "Best Utility Mod", removing "Control" from the equation, I would recommend Kerbal Engineer Redux and Kerbal Alarm Clock. The former for the display readouts (though MechJeb and VOID are also contenders for engineering output), and the latter as a critical element as soon as you have two or more long-distance (interplanetary) missions going.

For "Best Physics Mod", I'd suggest Ferram Aerospace Research, which replaces the (poor) stock aerodynamic model with a much more realistic one. You get less resistance-from-drag, which makes things easier, but you get stall and radial drag forces which sharply penalize poor design or poor piloting.

For "Best Structural Parts Mod", I'd suggest Kerbal Joint Reinforcement (gives you less wobbly rockets).

Some people think they're better pilots than mechjeb, maybe they really are, but I certainly am not. The only ships I've built that MechJeb can't handle are so unbalanced in some way that I have a hard time believing they're controllable at all.

If you want an autopilot, I think MechJeb is the best choice. Use as much or as little of its functionality as you like and have fun.
